divs: sighting detailsat 5:05 in the morning, i went to take my dogs outside. it was a very clear morning, a bright cresent moon, very dark still. i looked up, saw a bright light to the east\south east that appeared to be flashing and changing position sightly. it was acting like a hovering object that was "bobbing" up and down and to the left\right some. it was not stable in place, but it was not also moving in any particular direction, just maintaing it's position more or less. randomly much smaller whitish lights would flash at various ditances from the main light. some would be very close, some would be quite far away (maybe 30 or so widths of the main light). watching, it became quite obvious to me this not ust a star or planet. i looked around the sky. and to the east i saw another one, brighter that the first. same "bobbing" movement, same random radial flashing lights. i watched them for about 10 miuntes. at this point i went inside to get my wife so she could verify what i was seeing, and we observed them from our bedroom window. after about 5 minutes, i went outside again, stood the same spot and noticed that the second light had drifted to the south east some. it's location over the trees had changed, yet the first one had stayed more or less in the same location - again using the tree tops as reference and being in the same spot as i had previously been. i began to look around the sky some more, and began noticing other ligts doing the exact same thing as the first 2. these were less bright, some not much brighter than the stars (2 were right near the stars in orion's belt and not much brighter). all had the flashing lights that blinked randomly around the main light. i counted 7 total. the arrangment in the sky seemed random, some were lower toward the horizon, some higher, but all were to the east and south east. after maybe a total of 35 minutes watching them, the flashing smaller lights seemed to stop, leaving only the main light in each of the 7 cases. i watched them until dawn, at which point they began to fade into the light. all except for the second one i observed seemed to stay in place more or less.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Gorham
There were no other sightings in Gorham on or around September 14th 2009
Summary: Approx. 7 bright lights, each moving or shifting position silghtly with random blinking radial lilghts
